DataElement.preferredName: Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma Diagnosis Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to the determination of the presence of a peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma, consisting of usually large anaplastic, CD30 positive cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the determination of the presence of a peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma, consisting of usually large anaplastic, CD30 positive cells.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma, consisting of usually large anaplastic, CD30 positive cells.  Majority of cases are positive for the anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALK) protein.  The most frequently seen genetic alteration is a t(2;5) translocation.  Majority of patients present with advanced disease.  The most important prognostic indicator is ALK positivity, which has been associated with a favorable prognosis. (WHO, 2001)

Concepts.definition: A peripheral (mature) T-cell lymphoma, consisting of usually large anaplastic, CD30 positive cells. The majority of cases are positive for the anaplastic large cell lymphoma (ALK) protein. The most frequently seen genetic alteration is a t(2;5) translocation. Majority of patients present with advanced disease. The most important prognostic indicator is ALK positivity, which has been associated with a favorable prognosis. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredDefinition: The process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
